poem:
"Contours of Freedom"

In the chessboard of diplomacy,
pawns in the guise of Tories old,
maneuver fears and loathing, a symphony
of rattling chains in wintertime cold.

In the tempest of voices, a tide,
we see not mob rule, nor discordant fray,
but the echo of liberties, undenied,
untamed in the breaking day.

A safety net woven with gold,
a cheap veil on the price of dissent,
Yet the tale of freedom is bold,
its song, in whispers, we shall scat.
